docs.snippet: As a struggling Europe considers a sweeping new privacy law, Facebook's chief operating officer, Sheryl Sandberg, calls for a friendly regulatory environment that promotes innovation....
docs.lead_paragraph: Concerned about privacy? Maybe you should be concernedabout the economy instead. That was the subtext of a keynote speech by Sheryl Sandberg, Facebook's chief operating officer, at a technology conference in the heart of Europe on Tuesday.
docs.abstract: As a struggling Europe considers a sweeping new privacy law, Facebook's chief operating officer, Sheryl Sandberg, calls for a friendly regulatory environment that promotes innovation.

headline.main: Facebook's Sandberg Gently Warns Europe About Privacy Rules

docs.snippet: News organizations including CBS Sports and The Huffington Post repeated a false report that Joe Paterno had died on Saturday, a day before his family announced his death....
docs.lead_paragraph: News organizations including CBS Sports and The Huffington Post repeated a false report that Joe Paterno had died on Saturday, a day before his family announced his death.
docs.abstract: News organizations including CBS Sports and The Huffington Post repeated a false report that former Penn State coach Joe Paterno had died on Jan 21, a day before his family announced his death.

headline.seo: Behind Premature Reports of Joe Paterno’s Death
headline.main: Mistaken Early Report on Paterno Roiled Web
headline.print_headline: Mistaken Early Report On Paterno Roiled Web

docs.snippet: The Indian government wants social media companies to screen their content....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Indian government has asked social media operators to delete information on the Internet that might offend  the ''sensibilities'' of people in India, Kapil Sibal, India's minister of communications and information technology, said  Tuesday, confirming an earlier India Ink report.
docs.abstract: The Indian government wants social media companies to screen their content.

headline.main: 'Any Normal Human Being Would Be Offended'

docs.lead_paragraph: On Tuesday at 1 p.m. EST, I'm hosting an hour-long Facebook conversation about domestic politics and the presidential campaign. The chat will take place on the New York Times's Facebook page: facebook.com/nytimes.
docs.abstract: I'll be fielding questions from readers on Tuesday at 1 p.m.

docs.snippet: The social media scholar Reynol Junco answers questions about his recent findings -- some of which may surprise you -- about the kinds of behaviors correlated with certain ways college students use Facebook....
docs.lead_paragraph: Is Facebook a worthless waste of time for students? Does it steal time and energy that they would otherwise spend on homework? Is it focusing their attention on trivia, facilitating unhealthy interactions with peers and teachers, and turning their minds to jelly?
docs.abstract: The social media scholar Reynol Junco answers questions about his recent findings -- some of which may surprise you -- about the kinds of behaviors correlated with certain ways college students use Facebook.

headline.main: Q. and A. | How Facebook Use Correlates With Student Outcomes

docs.snippet: After 50 years of studying Moroccan cuisine, she finds an unexpected flood of information....
docs.lead_paragraph: Paula Wolfert has been studying Moroccan food for almost 50 years, but in conversations about her new book, "The Food of Morocco," she said she was unprepared for the flood of information unleashed by the Facebook group she started recently.
docs.abstract: After 50 years of studying Moroccan cuisine, she finds an unexpected flood of information.

headline.main: Paula Wolfert Finds Lots of Love for Morrocan Food on Facebook
